DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

NOISE ABATEMENT PROCEDURES : ANY TYPE OF ACFT : REACH AS SOON AS POSSIBLE 3000FT AAL (3900FT AMSL). ALL DEPARTING 'BALE-MULHOUSE' SID ACFT MUST ADOPT A NADP1 STARTING PROFILE (REF. OACI PANS OPS 8168 VOLUME 1), SO MAINTAIN SPEED V2 + 10KT OR THE ONE THAT ALLOWS THE ATTITUDE OF FLIGHT, ACCORDING TO THE TYPE OF ACFT, UNTIL 3000FT AAL USING THE WING FLAP DEFLECTION IN THE TAKE-OFF CONFIGURATION. BEYOND 3000FT AAL, ADOPT A NORMAL CLIMB OUT SPEED AND RETRACT FLAPS. REF : AD 2 LFSB SID RWY 15 RNAV, AD 2 LFSB RWY 33 RNAV

WITH REFERENCE TO ITALIAN CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY (ENAC)PROVISION 4 JUN 2024, DUE TO REDUCED AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT PARKING STANDS FOR NOT SCHEDULED FLIGHTS, THE MANAGEMENT OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS ON ARRIVAL WILL TAKE PLACE AS FOLLOWS: 1)IN ORDER TO SAFEGUARD THE AVAILABILITY OF PARKING STANDS FOR FLIGHTS REGULARLY SCHEDULED AT THE AIRPORT, THE DIVERTED FLIGHTS, AFTER LANDING, WILL BE PARKED ON THE APRON ONLY IN THE PRESENCE OF APPROPRIATE PARKING STANDS AVAILABLE FOR AT LEAST 2 HOURS (OR EVEN LONGER DEPENDING ON CURRENT OPERATIONAL SITUATION). IN THE ABSENCE OF SUCH TIPOLOGY OF AIRCRAFT STAND, DIVERTED FLIGHTS COULD BE SUBJECT TO LONG LASTING WAIT IN THE MOVEMENT AREA (EVEN A FEW HOURS), WITHOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF DISEMBARKING PASSENGERS, BAGS AND FREIGHT 2)THE CREW OF DIVERTED FLIGHTS PARKED IN THE MOVEMENT AREA ARE REQUESTED TO CONTACT HANDLER'S VHF FREQUENCY TO COMMUNICATE ANY REDUCTION IN EXPECTED ETD FROM THE AIRPORT, IN ORDER TO ALLOW THE AERODROME OPERATOR TO RE-EVALUATE THE AVAILABILITY OF AIRCRAFT STANDS ON THE APRON REF AIP AD 2 LIPE 1-23 ITEM 2.20 'LOCAL AERODROME REGULATIONS'

KARLSRUHE UAC USES THE EUROCONTROL LOGON LIST TO STABILIZE CPDLC PERFORMANCE. ALL LOGON LISTED ACFT SHALL LOG ON TO KARLSRUHE UAC. DATA LINK ADDRESS OF KARLSRUHE UAC IS EDUU. NOT LOGON LISTED ACFT SHALL NOT TRY TO LOGON TO EDUU. LOGON FORWARDING FOR NOT LOGON LISTED ACFT WILL NOT BE PERFORMED. FOR OVERFLIGHTS OR ARRIVALS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED BY THE PILOT, WITH SUFFICIENT NOTICE (BETWEEN 10 AND 25 MINUTES BEFORE ENTERING THE CRNA), TO ENSURE THAT THE CONNECTION IS ESTABLISHED, AND WITH THE FIRST FRENCH ACC CROSSED. IF LOGON HAS ALREADY BEEN ESTABLISHED WITH AN ADJACENT UPSTREAM ACC PROVIDING LOGON FORWARD, OR IF FORWARD HAS FAILED, ADVANCE NOTICE IS NOT REQUIRED. FOR FLIGHTS DEPARTING FROM FRENCH AIRFIELDS, LOGON MUST BE INITIATED NO LATER THAN CROSSING FL150. IF LOGON IS IMPOSSIBLE FOR A TECHNICAL REASON KNOWN OR UNKNOWN TO THE E PILOT, THE CREW WILL ANNOUNCE 'UNABLE CPDLC'. REFERENCE AIP FRANCE GEN 3.4-9.

FOR EN-ROUTE OPERATIONS THE RESPECTIVE VOR SHALL BE SELECTED FOR NAVIGATION INSTEAD OF THE NDB IN CASE OF HOMONYMOUS IDENTIFIERS. THIS APPLIES TO KFT. FLIGHT CREWS ARE ADVISED TO MONITOR THE CORRECT SELECTION OF THE VOR FOR EN-ROUTE OPERATIONS. IN CASE THE USAGE OF THE RESPECTIVE NDB IS REQUIRED, ATC SHALL BE INFORMED UPON INITIAL CONTACT.

REF AIP AUSTRIA, GEN 3.4 ITEM 3.4. INCREASED CPDLC USAGE WILL BE ENDEAVOURED BY ATC IN THE AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY OF ACC WIEN AND APP LOWW. ALL DATA LINK EQUIPPED AIRCRAFT (CPDLC ATN VDL MODE 2) ARE REQUESTED TO LOG ON TO ACC WIEN / APP WIEN. THE DATA LINK ADDRESS FOR ACC WIEN/ APP WIEN IS LOVV. FLIGHT CREWS SHALL EXPECT TO RECEIVE UPLINK MESSAGES ESPECIALLY IN SITUATIONS OF HIGH RTF FREQUENCY LOAD AND ARE REQUESTED TO REACT TO THEM ASAP.

lsya:BriefingSection.sectionName: EXTENDED AREA AROUND DESTINATION ALTERNATE AIRPORT(S)

Paragraph.Text: AX0002/24 AIC RESTRICTION HLLL/TRIPOLI FIR VALIDITY: 02OCT-UFN IATA IN FLIGHT BROADCAST PROCEDURE (IFBP) - AFI REGION 1.LISTENING WATCH IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A LISTENING WATCH SHOULD BE MNTN ON THE DESIGNATED FREQ (126.9MHZ), 10 MIN BFR ENTERING THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. FOR AN ACFT TKOF FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE LATERAL LIMITS OF THE DESIGNATED AIRSPACE, LISTENING WATCH SHOULD START AS SOON AS APPROPRIATE AND BE MNTN TIL LVE THE AIRSPACE. 2.BROADCASTS INTERVALS IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT A BCST SHOULD BE PRONOUNCED IN ENGLISH AS FLW: -10 MIN BFR, ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -UPON ENTERING AN FIR WI THE IFBP REGION -AS SOON AS PRACTICABLE WHEN DEP FM AN AD LOCATED WI THE IFBP REGION -10 MIN BFR XNG OR JOINING AN ATS RTE OR XNG AN AWY OR WPT -EV 20 MIN -BFR A CHANGE IN FL -UPON RCH THE INTENDED FL -AT ANY OTHER TIME CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY THE PILOT. NOTE 1: IN THE INTEREST OF REDUCING CONGESTION ON THE IFBP FREQ, PILOTS MAY EXER DISCRETION TO OMIT CLOSELY SPACED REPETITIVE IFBP REPORTS, HOWEVER BCST INTERVALS SHOULD NOT EXCEED 20 MIN. NOTE 2: IT IS RECOMMENDED THAT THE IFBP FREQ 126.9 IS CLOSELY MNT AT ALL TIMES WHEN IN THE REGION; FOR EXAMPLE, NOT TO TURN OFF OR REDUCE VOLUME LEVELS ON THE TRANSMITTING/RECEIVING FREQ. 3.BROADCAST PROCEDURE IT IS RECOMMENDED A BCST MSG SHOULD BE STRUCTURED AS FLW: ALL STATIONS THIS IS ABC123 (FLT NR) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. ABC123 (FLT NR) AT FL (ALT MNTN) DIRECTION BOUND (DIRECTION) IN THE XXXX (FIR NAME) FIR. 4. OPERATING PROCEDURES 4.1. CHANGES IN CRUISING LVL ARE CONSIDERED NECESSARY BY PILOTS TO AVOID TFC CONFLICTS, FOR WEATHER AVOIDANCE, OR OTHER VALID OPR REASONS. WHEN CRUISING LVL CHANGES ARE UNAVOIDABLE, ALL AVBL ACFT LGT, WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT, SHOULD BE DISPLAYED WHILE CHANGING LEVELS. 4.2. COLLISION AVOIDANCE IF, ON RECEIPT OF A TFC INFO BCST FM ANOTHER ACFT, A PILOT TAKES A DECISION THAT IMMEDIATE ACTION IS NECESSARY TO AVOID AN IMMINENT COLLISION RISK TO HIS ACFT AND THIS CANNOT BE ACHIEVED FLW THE RIGHT-OF-WAY PROVISIONS OF ANNEX 2, HE SHOULD: UNLESS AN ALTERNATIVE MANEUVER APPEARS MORE APPROPRIATE, CLIMB OR DESCEND 500FT; DISPLAY ALL AVBL ACFT LGT WHICH WOULD IMPR THE VISUAL DETECTION OF THE ACFT; ASAP REPLY TO THE BCST ADVISING ACTION BEING TAKEN, AND SPECIFY ALT MNTN; NOTIFY THE ACTION TAKEN ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ; AS SOON AS THE SITUATION HAS BEEN RECTIFIED, RESUME THE ALLOCATED FL, NOTIFYING THE ACTION ON THE APPROPRIATE ATS FREQ. 4.3. NORMAL POSITION REPORTING PROCEDURES NML PSN REP PROC SHOULD BE CONT AT ALL TIMES, REGARDLESS OF ANY ACTION TAKEN TO INITIATE OR ACK A TFC INFO BCST. 4.4. OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS PILOTS SHALL ENSURE THAT TRANSPONDER PROC AS CONTAINED IN ICAO PANS OPS DOC 8168 ARE COMPLIED WITH AND IN THE ABSENCE OF OTHER DIRECTIONS FM ATC, OPR THE TRANSPONDER ON MODE A AND C CODE 2000. PILOTS SHALL ENSURE OPERATION OF TRANSPONDERS EVEN WHEN OUTSIDE RADAR COVERAGE IN ORDER TO ENABLE TCAS EQUIPPED ACFT TO IDENTIFY CONFLICTING TFC. USE OF TCAS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ICAO ANNEX 6 ALL TURBINE-ENG AIRPLANES OF A MAX CERTIFICATED TKOF MASS IN EXCESS OF 5700 KG OR AUTH TO CARRY MORE THAN 19 PAX SHALL BE EQUIPPED WITH ACAS II. IATA RECOMMENDS THE USE OF AN OPERABLE TCAS WHEN OPR WI THE CONTINENT OF AFRICA; AND RECOMMENDS SELECTION OF TA/RA MODE AT MAX RANGE. 4.5. USE OF SLOP: SLOP IS PROMOTED IN AFI REGION. 5. THE IFBP IN AFI IN MANY FIRS IN THE AFI REGION COM BOTH FIXED AND MOBILE HAVE EITHER NOT BEEN IMPLEMENTED OR OPR WELL BLW THE REQUIRED RELIABILITY. THIS HAS AN IMPACT ON THE PROPER PROVISION OF ATS, ESPECIALLY FIS. CONSEQUENTLY, THE AFI REGIONAL TECHNICAL CONFERENCE HAS DECIDED THAT THE IATA IN-FLT BCST PROC (IFBP) SHOULD BE USED WI DESIGNATED FIRS IN THE REGION AS AN INTERIM MEASURE TIL SUCH TIME AS COM FAC AFFECTING THE FIRS IN QUESTION HAVE BEEN IMPROVED. 6. DESIGNATED FREQ IN AFI FOR THE IFBP IS 126.9 MHZ. 7. IN THE AFI REGION THE IFBP SHOULD BE APPLIED IN THE FLW FIRS AND AIRSPACES: ASMARA, BRAZZAVILLE, KANO, KHARTOUM, KINSHASA, LUANDA, LUSAKA, TRIPOLI, MOGADISHU, NIAMEY, N DJAMENA, DAKAR.
